trip.summ: Full board 7 day climb to the summit of Mt Kilimanjaro
trip.introDescr: My friend, Rupert Tyer, invited me to join him in celebrating his 50th birthday by climbing Mt. Kililmanjaro.  I  invited my son, Kelly, and my college roommate, Zav to join me.  The three of us and 6 other friends of Rupert took at 8 day trip to the highest point in Africa
trip.introPic1span: The route - from west to east and slowly gaining altitude
trip.pageTitle: Two weeks in Africa - Climbing Mt. Kilimanjaro
trip.pageSubtitle: An adventure with Kelly and Zav

adventureDay.h1title: Arriving in Tanzania and the Rivertree Country Inn
adventureDay.h3: JFK to Amsterdam and then on to Kilimanjaro airport
adventureDay.pdesc: We arrived at Kilimanjaro airport after about 16 hours of flying time and 24 hours of travel.  The Rivertrees Country Inn, our home for the next few nights, was close by and we checked in and went to bed.  In the morning we explored our base camp and were joined by the rest of the team who flew in from London.

pictures.piccap: The Lodge at Rivertree
Our transport to the mountain

adventureDay.h3: We head into the park for a three hour hike with giraffes, zebra and many other animals
adventureDay.pdesc: The rest of our team arrived and we spent the day in Arusha NP with an easy hike and a bit of seeing the sites.

pictures.piccap: Wildlife all around during our acclimation hike in Arusha NP
The giraffes didn’t know what to make of Zav

adventureDay.h1title: Londorossi Gate, the Lemosho Trailhead up to Mti Mkubwa (Forest Camp)
adventureDay.h3: Day 1 - We learn the full meaning of 'Full Board'
adventureDay.pdesc: We depart Moshi for Londorossi Gate then drive to the Lemosho trailhead (another hour to reach the trailhead). Upon arrival at trailhead, we eat lunch, then commence through undisturbed forest which winds to the first camp site. on arrival the crew had everything set up and sang us into camp.
adventureDay.mapspan: The last leg before the hike

pictures.piccap: Following the Happy bus to the Lemosho trailhead
The crew - No Really - a 50 man support crew for 10 hikers

adventureDay.h3: Up out of the forest and our first look at the objective
adventureDay.pdesc: We continue on the trail leading out of the forest and into a savannah of tall grasses, heather, and volcanic rock draped with lichen beards. As we ascend through the lush rolling hills and cross several streams, we reach the Shira Ridge before dropping gently down to Shira 1 camp. The view of Kili from across the plateau is amazing.
adventureDay.mapspan: Zav and Kelly as we stop for lunch

pictures.piccap: Amazing clear night
Letting the guys doing the work go by

adventureDay.h1title: Shira 1 to Moir (13,700ft) with afternoon side hike (14,300)
adventureDay.h3: In camp by 3:30 and then an evening acclimatization hike
adventureDay.pdesc: We cross the Shira plateau which leads to Shira 2 camp on moorland meadows by a stream. Then we continue to Moir Hut, a little used site on the base of Lent Hills.
adventureDay.mapspan: The morning of Day 3 from Shira camp

pictures.piccap: Packing up in the morning
A long trudge out of camp

adventureDay.h1title: Moir past Lava Tower to Barranco (15,200 ft) to Barranco (13,000)
adventureDay.pdesc: By our third and fourth day on the mountain, the lush forests of lower Lemosho are a pretty memory. We are now doing what can best be described as walking on rocks through fog. Respicious plods along as slow as ever but there are fewer complaints. We are above 4,000m and the altitude makes a noticeable difference.
adventureDay.mapspan: The porters have nothing to worry about

pictures.piccap: Jambo!  Pole pole!
working our way thru Barranco

adventureDay.h3: A walk around the mountain before heading up.
adventureDay.pdesc: After breakfast, we leave Barranco and continue on a steep ridge passing the Barranco Wall, to the Karanga Valley campsite

pictures.piccap: It was a beautiful morning
Amazing stars after the weather clears.

adventureDay.h3: Our luck brings us to Upper Barafu and about 2 hours closer before our midnight climb
adventureDay.pdesc: After breakfast, we leave Karanga and hit the junction which connects with the Mweka Trail. We continue thru the Barafu Hut (15,200) to the Upper Barafu campsite (16,133 ft).  At this point, you have completed the South Circuit, which offers views of the summit from many different angles. Here we make camp, rest, enjoy dinner, and prepare for the summit day. The two peaks of Mawenzi and Kibo are to be seen from this position.

pictures.piccap: It is a very slow walk
We had Upper Barafu all to ourselves

adventureDay.h1title: Upper Barafu to Kili Summit (19,340 ft 5,895M)
adventureDay.h3: We reach Stella Point at dusk and continue for two more hours as the sun rises to the top.
adventureDay.pdesc: The tumultuous weather at the top of Kilimanjaro is most likely to be clear and quiet at dawn, which means the push from our final campsite begins at midnight. These six hours of nighttime hiking are a muddy mixture of awe and misery even while they are happening.
adventureDay.mapspan: For 5 hours we walked the final 3,000 feet thru the darkness.

pictures.piccap: When the sun rises for our last half mile we are trudging up a wide gravel path laid out between a huge glacier and a deep crater that proves Kilimanjaro was once an active volcano.
Finally our group is under that big green sign – perhaps not a brilliant shining example to the world of mountain climbers, but at least not the absolute opposite

adventureDay.h3: Final thank yous and on back to the Rivertree
adventureDay.pdesc: After hiking/sliding down thru the scree on the way back to Upper Barafu we took a nap and then walked sraight down the mountain to overnight at Millenium Camp and a final hike thru the forest to the Mweka Gate

pictures.piccap: One of many  unforgetable views
Coming thru the Mweka gate and the end of our journey
